Subjects: advice, spiritual; translations; tongue, advice concerning use of
_description: Hear much and speak little — two couplets translating ‘Cum nihil auscultes set plurima vana loquaris’ which precedes it in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
ȝif þu wilt nouth here but spekt wordis manie &
                    veyneBetre þu were to han on ere & mouþes to haan
                    tweyȝeffor to eres god vus ȝaf & mouth ne þaf but
                    on[Heren] michil & speken litel becomet wel ich wis mon
NLS18721.Note: Margin shaved with loss to last line.

Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 22.
